alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN HAMILTON AND BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Brookville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Oxford, Forest Park, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Trenton, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Harrison, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming, Mount Healthy, Deer Park, South Middletown and Finneytown. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 13 and 17. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 3. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 11 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
